DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value for the Functional Well-Being scale of the FACT-Ovarian questionnaire, an instrument that assesses general physical,  social, emotional and functional well-being, as well as brain  tumor-specific concerns.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: FACT-O Questionnaire Functional Well-Being Scale Result
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Outcome from the Functional Assessment of Chronic Therapy-Ovarian (FACT-O) questionnaire's Functional Well-Being Scale.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition:
Having to do with the ovaries, the female reproductive glands in which the ova (eggs) are formed. The ovaries are located in the pelvis, one on each side of the uterus.:A 50-item instrument that assesses general physical,
social, emotional and functional well-being, as well as brain
tumor-specific concerns.

Concepts.definition: Having to do with the ovaries, the female reproductive glands in which the ova (eggs) are formed. The ovaries are located in the pelvis, one on each side of the uterus.
A 50-item instrument that assesses general physical, social, emotional and functional well-being, as well as brain tumor-specific concerns.

Property.preferredDefinition: Function; what something is used for.:The state of the organism when it functions optimally without evidence of disease.:an ordered reference standard.:Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

Concepts.definition: The normal action performed by a structure or device.

Refers to a person's state of physical, mental and social well-being; usually it refers specifically to the state of being in good health, a state of complete physical, mental and social well-being, and does not consist only of the absence of disease or infirmity. In any organism health constitutes a form of homeostasis with inputs and outputs of energy and mass in approximate equilibrium allowing for growth and continued survival. In humans, a subjective feeling of well-being coming from somatic and cognitive perceptions is considered an essential component of health.
An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools
